metadata.title: CVE-2019-10193 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A stack-buffer overflow vulnerability was found in the Redis hyperloglogdata structure versions 3.x before 3.2.13, 4.x before 4.0.14 and 5.x before5.0.4. By corrupting a hyperloglog using the SETRANGE command, an attackercould cause Redis to perform controlled increments of up to 12 bytes pastthe end of a stack-allocated buffer.

criterions.comment: redis: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
